content:
CircDNA - Extrachromosomal Circular DNA Detection

Comprehensive bioinformatics pipeline for identifying extrachromosomal circular DNAs (ecDNAs) in eukaryotic cells. Supports multiple sequencing technologies including Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS), ATAC-seq, and Circle-seq to detect circular DNA structures ranging from small eccDNAs to large amplified oncogenic ecDNAs.

What is CircDNA?

CircDNA enables researchers to detect and characterize extrachromosomal circular DNA elements that play critical roles in cancer evolution, drug resistance, and gene amplification. Developed as part of the EU Horizon 2020 PRECODE project.

Key Features

  • Multiple Detection Methods: Circle-Map, CIRCexplorer2, Samblaster, AmpliconArchitect
  • Flexible Input: Supports FASTQ and BAM file formats
  • Multi-Technology Support: WGS, ATAC-seq, Circle-seq compatible
  • Size Range Coverage: From small eccDNAs/microDNAs to large amplified ecDNAs
  • De Novo Assembly: Unicycler integration for detailed reconstruction
  • Containerized: Docker/Singularity for reproducibility

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Read Preprocessing: FastQ file merging and organization
  2. Quality Control: FastQC for read quality assessment
  3. Adapter Trimming: Quality and adapter trimming
  4. Read Mapping: BWA-MEM alignment to reference genome
  5. Alignment Processing: Sorting and indexing with Samtools
  6. ecDNA Identification: Multiple detection algorithms applied in parallel
  7. De Novo Assembly: Optional Unicycler assembly for detailed structures
  8. Results Integration: Comprehensive MultiQC reporting

Scientific Applications

  • Cancer Research: Detect oncogene amplification on ecDNA
  • Drug Resistance: Identify resistance gene amplification
  • Genome Instability: Study circular DNA formation mechanisms
  • Evolution Studies: Track rapid genetic changes via ecDNA
  • Chromatin Biology: Understand 3D genome organization

Detection Methods

  • Circle-Map ReadExtractor: Identifies circular DNA from split reads
  • CIRCexplorer2: Detects back-splice junctions
  • Samblaster: Split-read and discordant pair analysis
  • AmpliconArchitect: Reconstructs focal amplifications
  • Unicycler: De novo assembly for detailed characterization

Input Requirements

  • FASTQ Files: Paired-end WGS, ATAC-seq, or Circle-seq reads
  • BAM Files: Pre-aligned reads (optional)
  • Sample Sheet: CSV with sample information
  • Reference Genome: FASTA and index files

Main Outputs

  • ecDNA Coordinates: Genomic locations of circular DNAs
  • Structural Features: Size, gene content, breakpoints
  • Amplification Levels: Copy number estimates
  • Assembly Results: Reconstructed circular sequences
  • QC Reports: Comprehensive MultiQC summaries
  • Visualization Files: Circos plots and coverage tracks

Perfect for: Cancer Genomics • ecDNA Detection • Drug Resistance • Oncogene Amplification • Genome Instability
